item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, October 4, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Getting my daily news from a dot matrix printer (450 points | 149 comments)
2. Meta Movie Gen (686 points | 611 comments)
3. Bureaucrat Mode (14 points | 1 comment)
4. Show HN: One – A new React framework unifying web, native and local-first (298 points | 93 comments)
5. 12 Months of Mandarin (273 points | 152 comments)
6. Upstream containers with compiler toolchains from kernel.org (20 points | discuss)
7. Show HN: The Gmail unsubscribe tool with bulk deletion and personal data removal (30 points | 13 comments)
8. Carma (YC W24) Is Hiring Software Engineers to Get Fleets Same-Day Auto Repair ( | hide)
9. Show HN: FFmpeg-over-IP – Connect to remote FFmpeg servers (52 points | 28 comments)
10. How were 70s versions of games like Pong built without a programmable computer? (25 points | 9 comments)
11. Show HN: Chebyshev approximation calculator (204 points | 35 comments)
12. Teenage hacker became a legend attacking companies, then his rivals attacked him (6 points | 1 comment)
13. ESP32: leaving love notes and entering demoscene territory (2022) (107 points | 10 comments)
14. Experimental web browser optimized for rabbit-holing (491 points | 95 comments)
15. Safety Goggles for Alchemists (41 points | 16 comments)
16. Why does man print "gimme gimme gimme" at 00:30? (2017) (857 points | 359 comments)
17. Computer scientists combine two 'beautiful' proof methods (61 points | 9 comments)
18. Show HN: open source framework OpenAI uses for Advanced Voice (34 points | 3 comments)
19. Show HN: A tool for creating chord charts on the go (106 points | 29 comments)
20. ESP8266 Analog Broadcast Television Interface (82 points | 14 comments)
21. Show HN: kew – A Terminal Music Player for Linux (109 points | 43 comments)
22. Mitmproxy 11: Full HTTP/3 Support (8 points | discuss)
23. Self-locking and stiffening deployable tubular structures (46 points | 5 comments)
24. 52 Factorial (63 points | 43 comments)
25. Reverse engineering and dismantling Kekz headphones (170 points | 31 comments)
26. Knowledge Growth and Specialization: Evidence from Oncologists (33 points | 2 comments)
27. Activist wins privacy case against Meta over personal data on sexual orientation (21 points | 11 comments)
28. Manuscripts reveal the details of everyday life on the Silk Road (83 points | 16 comments)
29. Robert Dennard, DRAM Pioneer, has died (328 points | 27 comments)
30. Wikipedia and Wikidata as sources for analyzing Americanization (13 points | discuss)
